com.vaadin.addon.charts.model
Class StackLabels

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.AbstractConfigurationObject
      com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.StackLabels
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class StackLabels
extends AbstractConfigurationObject

The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

See Also:
Serialized Form

setAlign

public void setAlign(HorizontalAlign align)
Defines the horizontal alignment of the stack total label. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on the orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

getTextAlign

public HorizontalAlign getTextAlign()
Returns:
The alignment of the text or null if not defined
See Also:
setTextAlign(HorizontalAlign)

setTextAlign

public void setTextAlign(HorizontalAlign textAlign)
Sets the text alignment for the label. While setAlign(HorizontalAlign) determines where the texts anchor point is placed with regards to the stack, setTextAlign(HorizontalAlign) determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

Parameters:
textAlign -
